newsitem.title: USA: NYSE program trading averages 11 pct of volume.
newsitem.headline: NYSE program trading averages 11 pct of volume.

text.p: The New York Stock Exchange said program trading averaged 11.0 percent of its average daily volume of 434.5 million shares, or 48.0 million shares, for the week of October 14-18.
Program trading accounted for an average of 8.3 percent of average daily volume of 403.0 million shares for the week of October 7-11.
Of the average 48.0 million shares during the week, buy programs accounted for an average 25.9 million shares, while sell programs accounted for an average 22.1 million daily.
In all markets, program trading averaged 63.5 million shares a day during the week of October 14-18.

Of the five member firms reporting the most program activity on the New York Stock Exchange, Morgan Stanley, Lehman Bros., and CS First Boston conducted most of its program activity for their own accounts. First Options and Bear Stearns executed all or most of their program activity for customers.

Program trading executed by firms as agent, for non-member customers, amounted to 56.2 percent during the week, while volume executed as principal, for their own accounts, amounted to 41.7 percent of program volume from October 14-18.

Between October 14 and October 18, 30.0 percent of program trading volume executed by NYSE member firms was related to index arbitrage, while another 13.5 percent involved other derivative product-related strategies.
Program trading encompasses trading strategies involving the sale or purchase of a basket of at least 15 stocks with a value of $1 million or more the exchange said.
